title: National Hurricane Center: Sally bringing 'life-threatening' flooding
description: NBC News’ Sam Brock reports on the rainfall and aftermath of Hurrican Sally after the storm brought over 30 inches of rain to the Florida panhandle.

author: NBCNews.com
title: Big Ten college football will return in October
description: The Big Ten had canceled its fall season due to coronavirus just over a month ago — getting stunned responses from players, coaches and President Trump. Now it will play an eight game season with new health protocols.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Firefighters struggle to contain Bobcat fire in Southern California
description: NBC News’ Steve Patterson reports on the growing Bobcat fire in Southern California as firefighters struggle to contain the flames.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Nurses ensure sick patients can vote in upcoming elections
description: Nurses Lisa Schavrien and Erin Smith created a program to help Lenox Hill Hospital patients vote, even hand-delivering absentee ballots to the local election board. Now the idea is spreading to other health care facilities.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: New images show scope of Western wildfire devastation
description: As wildfires continue to burn in the West, communities are beginning to survey the damage. A single Oregon county has seen more than 2,300 homes obliterated and dozens of people remain unaccounted for.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Trump defends coronavirus response at town hall
description: When voters asked President Trump about his fight against the coronavirus, Trump said “I up-played it in terms of action.” His comments come after the president acknowledged downplaying the threat of the virus in a taped interview with journalist Bob Woodward.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: New details on U.S. distribution plan for a Covid vaccine
description: Once a coronavirus vaccine receives FDA approval, the CDC and Defense Department will work together to dispense the free vaccines in three phases, with a priority for health care workers and those at-risk for severe illness.
source.name: NBC News

title: Hurricane Sally makes landfall in Alabama
description: Hurricane Sally made landfall early Wednesday, unleashing 100 mph winds, ripping down trees and traffic lights and destroying homes. Residents along the Florida Panhandle are now dealing with “catastrophic flooding.”
